LabRat Needs to be able to Access Your Google Account To Proceed
There is already a class in that slot
Classes Booked for This Venue Today

Android Developers is the official site for all thing (development related) android. The site provides everything form Reference documentation to API guides that prove invaluable to newbie Android Developers. The Youtube channel also provides even more video resources to aid developers in implementing and understanding certain android development concepts

Google Developers (much like Android developers) is the go to resource for all of Google\'s services and gives developers handy examples and sample code as well as great Youtube resource videos. This resource came in handy fro the implementation of the Google Sign in

This resource was especially handy for some things that were not made clear enough for novice Android developers on the Google and Android Developers websites. it is packed with many tutorials with thorough explanations

Not many programmers (if any) can say they can live without going through stack overflow. If you have a programming question, its probably already been answered on Stack Overflow. very useful for quick answers to things that I felt weren\'t clearly highlighted in Android Developers

The de facto standard when it comes Android development. This IDE has a multitude of features tha could take an app alone to go through. Some of its more useful features include intelligent code completion, great UI editor support for a multitude of plugins and not to mention amazing debugging capabilities and version control integration

An open source database library which provides a standalone database for embedded projects (such as Android apps). A bit of a pain to work it in the beginning on Android, but once the user gets the hang of it, it almost became second nature. Great simple database implementation that is also light on resources

Great Version control software that allows tracking of changes in your code, ensuring I always have checkpoint-like stages of my app, allowing me to track my progress and revert any (retarded) errors easily back to any point where I see acceptable

With Git version control working, Github allows online hosting of your Git projects on their servers. This allowed safe backups of this app and online tracking of changes made while allowing me to work in different locations (be it home or campus)
Icons Galore. This resource is an amazing tool to use for developers who require tons (literally) of free icons to use in their designs
Week Two (Sitting on my hands … sort of)
Week Six (Final Touch Ups and TimeLine)

The database, (probably the most tedious job and definitely the most underestimated) took two days alone to take care of, and even then was only about 75% done, All i had really done was take care of the contract class (which would prove to be invaluable) and create the data model and eventual database

A Common occurrence this semester, but honestly this time it was more due to trying to focus on exams and get them out of the way, at least this time wasn\'t wasted as I took some time to draw out how my layouts would look and function on paper.

This was the week where a lot of the work was coming together nicely. It was by far the slowest week as it was filled with steep learning curves and speedhumps, but this week proved to be the must productive despite it not reflecting visually on the application, yet

As the presentation date approaches I realised I might not complete the project to the degree I wold have liked. Working through the night, I strongly considered taking the 2nd opportunity exam opportunity, and at 04:00am my brain made the decision for me. It just died. No Development Blog in Sight

This week was filled the creation of the Development blog, minor touch ups to UI elements and database interactions and fixing of a few minor bugs, The decision to hold of presentation seemed like a good one at this point

Finally the Timeline was being done (Left it till late because it would document my progress, duh) and I hae to say Im proud of what I have created. Not the most groundbreaking design but it has all I need to get a decent mark
